results.title: Uluru
results.brief_description: In this avant-garde videofilm by Michael Glasheen time lapse photography, superimposition’s and video mixing are used to relate Aboriginal myths such as Wanambi, the rainbow serpent, to the topography of Ayers Rock.
results.description: In this avant-garde videofilm by Michael Glasheen time lapse photography, superimposition’s and video mixing are used to relate Aboriginal myths such as Wanambi, the rainbow serpent, to the topography of Ayers Rock.

results.title: Ultrasonic examination of the brain in children
results.brief_description: A specialist medical film describing a new ultrasonic technique for the examination of the brain in children, developed by Australia’s National Acoustics Laboratories and the Royal Hospital for Women, Sydney The technique provides for accurate visualisation of the size and shape of the lateral and third ventricles and of space-occupying lesions, and provides much the same information as X-ray air studies

results.title: Ultra vires
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff, Victorian College of the Arts and Emma Kelly
results.brief_description: A 2-d hand-drawn animation about a young woman who fights off the attacks of a fierce dragon. Before the woman kills the dragon with her sword the dragon manages to make his slow but fatal blow. No dialogue but music performed by Peter Tumble, James Wilkinson and Gareth Skinner.

results.title: Ulster heritage
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Film Producers Guild and Stanley Willis
results.brief_description: From the story of one family and one farm in Northern Ireland, a colorful and impressive picture of a modern farming community emerges, giving incidental glimpses of Ulster as a highly modern industrialised province and a place of considerable scenic attractions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Film Producers Guild and Stanley Willis

results.title: Ulster
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scenic and sporting attractions of Northern Ireland and records, in particular, sequences from recent Tourist Trophy motor and Grand Prix motor-cycle events (featuring Stirling Moss). The film includes a visit to Belfast, capital of Northern Ireland; scenic attractions among the mountain and lake country; a visit to Carlingford Lough and the Silent Valley; a drive through the Glen of Antrim to Portrush, famous for its swimming, sailing and its golf course.

results.title: UK Prime Minister in Africa
results.brief_description: Scenes from Mr Harold MacMillan’s tour of Africa in the spring of 1960. Accompanied by Lady Dorothy MacMillan, the Prime Minister visits Ghana, Nigeria and the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland, witnessing both the spectacular material progress in these quickly developing territories and the friendliness and goodwill which have not been affected by the achievement of the prospect of independence.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari [Extract]
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company and Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: An extract from what is considered to be a masterpiece of Japanese director, Kenji Mizoguchi. Set in sixteenth century Japan, its theme is that of the humble commoner who aspires to wealth and glory only to find them, when achieved, a delusion leading to agony and shame. In Japanese with English subtitles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Uf-oh
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Glenn Melenhorst
results.brief_description: Adrian (voice by Egan Gill) is quietly working on his computer, but his trusty companion, a bandicoot named Openhiemer (voice by Paul Gherig), has other plans. Openheimer meddles with the computers and taps into some alien life, causing all sorts of mischief.
